sen.j: 大蔵寺 （おおくらじ）は奈良県宇陀市大宇陀町にある龍門真言宗の寺院である。
sen.e: Okura-ji is a Buddhist temple of Ryumon Shingon sect situated in Ouda-cho, Uda City, Nara Prefecture.
Okura-ji Temple is a Buddhist temple of the Ryumon Shingon sect situated in Ouda-cho, Uda City, Nara Prefecture.
sen.cmt: ・Okura-jiにTempleを追加しました。・sectに定冠詞を付けました。
sen.e: Okura-ji Temple is a Buddhist temple of the Ryumon Shingon sect situated in Ouda-cho, Uda City, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 山号は雲管山（うんかんざん）。
sen.e: Its sango (literally, "mountain name"), the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple, is Unkanzan.
Its sango (literally, "mountain name"), the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple, is Unkanzan.
Its sango (literally, "mountain name"), the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple, is Unkanzan.

sen.j: 院号は医王院。
sen.e: Its ingo (the title given to a Buddhist temple) is Ioin.
Its ingo (the title given to a Buddhist temple) is Ioin.
Its ingo (the title given to a Buddhist temple) is Ioin.

sen.j: 本尊は薬師如来。
sen.e: Its honzon (the principal image of Buddha) is Yakushi Nyorai (the Healing Buddha).
Its honzon (the principal image of Buddha) is Yakushi Nyorai (the Healing Buddha).
Its honzon (the principal image of Buddha) is Yakushi Nyorai (the Healing Buddha).

sen.j: 大蔵寺のある宇陀市大宇陀区は、古代には阿騎野と呼ばれ、皇室の狩猟地であった。
sen.e: The place of Okura-ji Temple, Ouda-ku, Ouda City, was called Akino in the ancient times, and was used as an imperial hunting ground.
The place of Okura-ji Temple, Ouda-ku, Ouda City, was called Akino in the ancient times, and was used as an imperial hunting ground.
The place of Okura-ji Temple, Ouda-ku, Ouda City, was called Akino in the ancient times, and was used as an imperial hunting ground.

sen.j: 大宇陀区の中心の松山地区は近世初期には宇陀松山藩が置かれたところで、松山 (宇陀市)は国の重要伝統的建造物群保存地区に選定されている。
sen.e: Matsuyama District, the center of Ouda-ku, was the Uda-Matsuyama Domain in the early modern times, and Matsuyama (Uda City) has been chosen as Preservation District for Groups of Important Historic Buildings.

Matsuyama District, the center of Ouda-ku, was the Uda-Matsuyama Domain in the early modern times, and Matsuyama (Uda City) has been chosen as Preservation District for Groups of Important Historic Buildings.

Matsuyama District, the center of Ouda-ku, was the Uda-Matsuyama Domain in the early modern times, and Matsuyama (Uda City) has been chosen as Preservation District for Groups of Important Historic Buildings.

sen.j: 大蔵寺は松山地区と吉野方面を結ぶ国道370号沿いの山中の栗野地区にあり、国道から急な坂道を1kmほど登ったところに位置する。
sen.e: Okura-ji Temple is located in the mountains in Kurino District, along National Route 370, which connects Matsuyama District and Yoshino, and it is about a one-kilometer walk on a steep slope from the national route.

Okura-ji Temple is located on the mountains in Kurino District, along National Route 370, which connects Matsuyama District and Yoshino, and it is about a one-kilometer walk on a steep slope from the national route.
sen.cmt: mountainsの前置詞をonにしました。
sen.e: Okura-ji Temple is located on the mountains in Kurino District, along National Route 370, which connects Matsuyama District and Yoshino, and it is about a one-kilometer walk on a steep slope from the national route.

sen.j: 大蔵寺の草創については判然としない。
sen.e: It is not clear when and how Okura-ji Temple was built.
It is not clear when and how Okura-ji Temple was built.
It is not clear when and how Okura-ji Temple was built.

sen.j: 寺伝では用明天皇の勅願により聖徳太子が創建したと伝わる。
sen.e: The temple's history says it was founded by Shotoku Taishi (Prince Shotoku) on the order of Emperor Yomei.
The temple's history says it was founded by Shotoku Taishi (Prince Shotoku) on the order of Emperor Yomei.
The temple's history says it was founded by Shotoku Taishi (Prince Shotoku) on the order of Emperor Yomei.

sen.j: 平安時代初期には37歳の空海（弘法大師）が入山し、真言宗最初の道場と定めたとされる。
sen.e: It is believed that in the early Heian period, thirty-seven-year-old Kukai (Kobo Daishi or Great Priest Kobo) entered the temple to live there, and designated it as the first temple of Shingonshu sect.

It is believed that in the early Heian period, thirty-seven-year-old Kukai (Kobo Daishi or Great Priest Kobo) entered the temple to live there, and designated it as the first temple of the Shingon sect.
sen.cmt: 真言宗の訳語を用語集に合わせて修正しました。
sen.e: It is believed that in the early Heian period, thirty-seven-year-old Kukai (Kobo Daishi or Great Priest Kobo) entered the temple to live there, and designated it as the first temple of the Shingon sect.

sen.j: 弘法大師が高野山を開く前に道場としたとされることから「元高野」とも呼ばれ、信仰されてきた。
sen.e: As Kobo Daishi decided that it was the temple of Shingoshu sect before he opened Koyasan Mountain (the holy place of Shingonshu sect), Okura-ji Temple has also been called 'Moto Koya' (original Koya), and has been regarded as a religious site of the sect.

As Kobo Daishi decided that it was the temple of the Shingon sect before he opened Koyasan Mountain (the holy place of the Shingon sect), Okura-ji Temple has also been called 'Moto Koya' (original Koya), and has been regarded as a religious site of the sect.
sen.cmt: ・真言宗の訳語を用語集に合わせて修正しました。・sectに定冠詞を付けました。
sen.e: As Kobo Daishi decided that it was the temple of the Shingon sect before he opened Koyasan Mountain (the holy place of the Shingon sect), Okura-ji Temple has also been called 'Moto Koya' (original Koya), and has been regarded as a religious site of the sect.

sen.j: 本堂（重要文化財）
sen.e: Hondo (Main Hall) (important cultural property)
Hondo (Main Hall) (important cultural property)
Hondo (Main Hall) (important cultural property)

sen.j: 鎌倉時代の建築。
sen.e: The construction in the Kamakura period
The construction in the Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: ピリオドを追加しました。
sen.e: The construction in the Kamakura period.

sen.j: 寄棟造、杮（こけら）葺き。
sen.e: Yosemune-zukuri (hipped roof) style, Kokerabuki (with shingles)
Yosemune-zukuri (hipped roof) style, Kokerabuki (with shingles).
sen.cmt: ピリオドを追加しました。
sen.e: Yosemune-zukuri (hipped roof) style, Kokerabuki (with shingles).

sen.j: 大師堂（重要文化財）
sen.e: Daishi-do (Great Priest's Hall) (important cultural property)
Daishi-do (Great Priest's Hall) (important cultural property)
Daishi-do (Great Priest's Hall) (important cultural property)

sen.j: 鎌倉時代の建築。
sen.e: The construction in the Kamakura period
The construction in the Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: ピリオドを追加しました。
sen.e: The construction in the Kamakura period.

sen.j: 宝形造、杮葺きの建物で、弘法大師を祀る大師堂としては日本最古とされる。
sen.e: The construction is Hogyo-zukuri (pyramidal roof) style with Kokerabuki (shingles), and is considered to be the oldest Daishi-do in Japan dedicated to Kobo Daishi.
The construction is Hogyo-zukuri (pyramidal roof) style with Kokerabuki (shingles), and is considered to be the oldest Daishi-do in Japan dedicated to Kobo Daishi.
The construction is Hogyo-zukuri (pyramidal roof) style with Kokerabuki (shingles), and is considered to be the oldest Daishi-do in Japan dedicated to Kobo Daishi.

sen.j: 堂内には「厄除開運の御影」とも呼ばれる空海37歳の坐像が安置される。
sen.e: Enshrined in it is the seated statue of thirty-seven-year-old Kukai, sometimes called 'the Statue of Yakuyoke-kaiun (warding off evil and bringing in good fortune).'
Enshrined in it is the seated statue of thirty-seven-year-old Kukai, sometimes called 'the Statue of Yakuyoke-kaiun (warding off evil and bringing in good fortune).'
Enshrined in it is the seated statue of thirty-seven-year-old Kukai, sometimes called 'the Statue of Yakuyoke-kaiun (warding off evil and bringing in good fortune).'

sen.j: 弁事堂
sen.e: Benji-do Hall
Benji-do Hall
Benji-do Hall

sen.j: 本堂より一段低い場所にある庫裏の脇に建つ小堂。
sen.e: A small hall next to Kuri (the priest's living place) situated on land slightly lower than that of Hondo (Main Hall)
A small hall next to Kuri (the priest's living place) situated on land slightly lower than that of Hondo (Main Hall).
sen.cmt: ピリオドを追加しました。
sen.e: A small hall next to Kuri (the priest's living place) situated on land slightly lower than that of Hondo (Main Hall).

sen.j: 明治時代の美術界を指導した岡倉天心が寄進したもの。
sen.e: Tenshin OKAKURA, the leader of the art world in the Meiji period, donated it.
Tenshin OKAKURA, the leader of the art world in the Meiji period, donated it.
Tenshin OKAKURA, the leader of the art world in the Meiji period, donated it.

sen.j: この寺の住職をしていた丸山貫長（明治の廃仏毀釈の時代に仏教復興運動に取り組んだ人物）は天心と親交があった。
sen.e: Tenshin had the friendship of one of the chief priests of the temple, Kancho MARUYAMA, who engaged in the Buddhism restoration movement during the time of the anti-Buddhism movement in the Meiji period.

Tenshin had the friendship of one of the chief priests of the temple, Kancho MARUYAMA, who engaged in the Buddhism restoration movement during the time of the anti-Buddhism movement in the Meiji period.

Tenshin had the friendship of one of the chief priests of the temple, Kancho MARUYAMA, who engaged in the Buddhism restoration movement during the time of the anti-Buddhism movement in the Meiji period.

sen.j: 内部に鎌倉時代の地蔵菩薩坐像を安置する。
sen.e: Inside the Benji-do Hall, a seated statue of Jizo Bosatsu is placed.
Inside the Benji-do Hall, a seated statue of Jizo Bosatsu (Jizo Bodhisattva) made in the Kamakura period is placed.
sen.cmt: ・用語集に合わせて「地蔵菩薩」の補足説明を加えました。・訳漏れ
sen.e: Inside the Benji-do Hall, a seated statue of Jizo Bosatsu (Jizo Bodhisattva) made in the Kamakura period is placed.

sen.j: 彩色や金箔を施さない素地仕上げとする。

sen.j: 衣文を密に刻まない素朴な作風の像である。
sen.e: Made in simple style with loosely carved folds in the robes

sen.j: 本来の尊名不明のため「天部形像」と呼ばれている。
sen.e: It is just called 'Tenbugyozo' (statue of a god in heaven) because the name of the god is unknown.

sen.j: 近鉄大阪線榛原駅より奈良交通バス（大宇陀行）終点「大宇陀」下車徒歩（約5㎞）
sen.e: Take a Nara Kotsu bus (for Ouda) from Haibara Station on the Kintetsu Osaka Line, get off at the last stop, 'Ouda,' and walk about five kilometers.
